TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit UriHelper extends System.Object
public ref class UriHelper abstract sealed

Docs.summary: A helper class for constructing encoded Uris for use in headers and other Uris.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string BuildAbsolute (string scheme, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HostString host, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.PathString pathBase = null, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.PathString path = null, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.QueryString query = null, Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.FragmentString fragment = null);

Docs.param: http, https, etc.
The host portion of the uri normally included in the Host header. This may include the port.
The first portion of the request path associated with application root.
The portion of the request path that identifies the requested resource.
The query, if any.
The fragment, if any.
Docs.summary: Combines the given URI components into a string that is properly encoded for use in HTTP headers. Note that unicode in the HostString will be encoded as punycode.
Docs.returns: The combined URI components, properly encoded for use in HTTP headers.

.method public static hidebysig string Encode(class System.Uri uri) cil managed
public: static System::String ^ Encode(Uri ^ uri);
static member Encode : Uri -> string

Docs.param: The Uri to encode.
Docs.summary: Generates a string from the given absolute or relative Uri that is appropriately encoded for use in HTTP headers. Note that a unicode host name will be encoded as punycode.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetDisplayUrl (this Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpRequest request);
.method public static hidebysig string GetDisplayUrl(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpRequest request) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function GetDisplayUrl (request As HttpRequest) As String
static member GetDisplayUrl : Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpRequest -> string

Docs.param: The request to assemble the uri pieces from.
Docs.summary: Returns the combined components of the request URL in a fully un-escaped form (except for the QueryString) suitable only for display. This format should not be used in HTTP headers or other HTTP operations.
Docs.returns: The combined components of the request URL in a fully un-escaped form (except for the QueryString) suitable only for display.
